hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I live in London cmt-med.com What was really sick-making, though, was Floridaâs easy assumption that creativity was a thing our society valued. Our correspondent had been hearing this all his life, since his childhood in the creativity-worshipping 1970s. He had even believed it once, in the way other generations had believed in the beneficence of government or the blessings of Providence. And yet his creative friends, when considered as a group, were obviously on their way down, not up. The institutions that made their lives possibleÂ â chiefly newspapers, magazines, universities and record labelsÂ â were then entering a period of disastrous decline. The creative world as he knew it was not flowering, but dying.
